required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Short-term Efficacy of Intravitreal Afilibercept Depending on Subtypes of Polypoidal Choroidal Vasculopathy: Polypoidal Choroidal Neovascularization or Idiopathic Choroidal Vasculopathy

brief_summary.textblock: To compare the short-term effect of intravitreal aflibercept injection between two subtypes of polypoidal choroidal vasculopathy

detailed_description.textblock: The subjects were classified into two subtypes (type 1 and type 2 polypoidal choroidal vasculopathy) based on the presence or the absence of both of a feeder and a draining vessels on indocyanine green angiography. All received intravitreal injection of aflibercept (2.0 mg) at baseline and months 1, 2 and 4.

primary_outcome.measure: Regression Rate of Polyp on Indocyanine Green Angiography
primary_outcome.description: Indocyanine green angiography performed initially and at 3 months were used to determine the polyp regression. The definition of complete polyp regression is that the polyps at initial visit disappeared at 3 months on indocyanine green angiography. The partial regression means the polyps remain, but the size decreased >30%.

secondary_outcome.description: Best corrected visual acuity assessed at baseline, 3 months, and 6 months

arm_group.description: Monthly intravitreal aflibercept injection for 3 months and 1 additional injection after 2 months. Indocyanine green angiography was used to classify the type of PCV and evaluate the polyp closure rate.

Monthly intravitreal aflibercept injection for 3 months and 1 additional injection after 2 months. Indocyanine green angiography was used to classify the type of PCV and evaluate the polyp closure rate.

intervention.description: Total 4 times of intravitreal aflibercept injection was performed

intervention.intervention_name: Indocyanine green angiography (intraveonus indocyanine green dye)
intervention.description: At initial visit, indocyanine green angiography was performed. After 1 month of third Aflibercept injection, indocyanine green angiography was performed to evaluate polyp closure.

study_pop.textblock: Consecutive patients were recruited from the retinal clinic of the Yeungnam university hospital. Recruitment started on October 01 2015 to March 31 2016.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. symptomatic typical PCV accompanying branch vascular network involving subfoveal area
2. signed informed consent; and
3. over 6 months follow-up period after enrollment.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. retinal diseases other than PCV
2. extrafoveal PCV not involving subfoveal area
3. massive subretinal hemorrhage blocking polypoidal lesion on ICGA
4. severe media opacity such as senile cataract
5. previous history of intravitreal injection
6. previous intraocular surgery history except cataract surgery which was done more than 3 months.

group.title: Type 1 Polypoidal Choroidal Vasculopathy
group.description: Monthly intravitreal aflibercept injection for 3 months and 1 additional injection after 2 months. Indocyanine green angiography was used to classify the type of PCV and evaluate the polyp closure rate. Aflibercept: Total 4 times of intravitreal aflibercept injection was performed Indocyanine green angiography (intraveonus indocyanine green dye): At initial visit, indocyanine green angiography was performed. After 1 month of third Aflibercept injection, indocyanine green angiography was performed to evaluate polyp closure.

After 1 month of third Aflibercept injection, indocyanine green angiography was performed to evaluate polyp closure.

group.title: Type 1 Polypoidal Choroidal Vasculopathy
group.description: Monthly intravitreal aflibercept injection for 3 months and 1 additional injection after 2 months from third injection. At initial visit, indocyanine green angiography was performed. After 1 month of third Aflibercept injection, indocyanine green angiography was performed to evaluate polyp closure.

outcome.title: Regression Rate of Polyp on Indocyanine Green Angiography
outcome.description: Indocyanine green angiography performed initially and at 3 months were used to determine the polyp regression. The definition of complete polyp regression is that the polyps at initial visit disappeared at 3 months on indocyanine green angiography. The partial regression means the polyps remain, but the size decreased >30%.
outcome.population: Participants who were finished 6 months follow up period.

measure.title: Regression Rate of Polyp on Indocyanine Green Angiography
measure.description: Indocyanine green angiography performed initially and at 3 months were used to determine the polyp regression. The definition of complete polyp regression is that the polyps at initial visit disappeared at 3 months on indocyanine green angiography. The partial regression means the polyps remain, but the size decreased >30%.
measure.population: Participants who were finished 6 months follow up period.

analysis.groups_desc: The difference of polyp regression rate between two groups were compared.

outcome.title: Best Corrected Visual Acuity
outcome.description: Best corrected visual acuity assessed at baseline, 3 months, and 6 months
outcome.population: Participants who were finished 6 months follow up period.

group.description: Monthly intravitreal aflibercept injection for 3 months and 1 additional injection after 2 months from third injection. measure.title: Best Corrected Visual Acuity
measure.description: Best corrected visual acuity assessed at baseline, 3 months, and 6 months
measure.population: Participants who were finished 6 months follow up period.

analysis.groups_desc: best corrected visual acuity was compared between two groups
analysis.method_desc: The Mann-Whitney test was used for a comparison of best corrected visual acuity assessed at baseline, 3 months, and 6 months between type1 and type2.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
